Would it be helpful to you to have an ap: yes because it took me a while to find a black dermatologist. not that other kinds of dermatologist wouldnt know black skin but i feel like a black dermatologist would be more likely to understand it and our sensitivities like not recommending cremes that lighten skin. it would also help to be able to find a second opinion.

name: Brianna

Do you think an educational app would be: i dont think an app would be as beneficial as youtube. people search youtube much more fervently. if someone goes on youtube and types, #melanoma is much easier for people to do than to go to an app store and download an app, something they probably wouldnt do.

How would you find this app?: if i did search, then id use the google play store
What do you do if you have a skin issue?: usually i resort to home remedies
Where would you go to learn about Melano: i got webmd, and another one that comes up from a basic google search. i think, healthline
Would it be helpful to you to have an ap: no, because im not an app person

Do you have a dermatologist?: id discuss with my primary care physician
heard of it but dont know anyone
nih medpub, the internet mayo clinic website
resources online like medpub and a google search

name: Dionny

How do patients currently keep track of: dr. candrice has students who are itching to do research and write papers that is skin related. they want to be future dermatologists.
How do you acquire patients?: black patients are not familiar with that at all
many dont think it can happen to them
someone on tv like jimmy carter, or john mccain, etc&
usually not presented to them through their primary care physician
usually someone who is knowledge is 1 degree away from someone who has had melanoma
Is there a standard way for your patient: not a standard way but i take pictures of them in the office.
sometimes they take photos of themselves in between visits.

there are also centers around the country that take photos of moles. i recommend this medical imaging for people who are molely and have a history of melanoma. this gives me high quality images. it allows me to monitor the abcdes.
i advise my patients to go to a plastic nevus clinic for actual people to look over the patient, manually. this along with the medical images helps greatly.
so yes, it can be on a basic level of me or my patient, all the way up to an advanced level where a center and professional can take pictures and review in person.
What kinds of educational material do yo: patient education sheet, or brochure about moles but its hard because the brochures arent focused on black skin
ive created education materials focused specifically on black skin for primary care physicians
Where is your practice located?: for people who have it, about <5% of patients have it or a history
name: Dr. Candrice

Are there any pain points in tracking yo: as long as the pictures are clear, and not fuzzy. if they can identify where the mole is because sometimes the photos are taken so close up that you cant tell where the mole is. its better when the patients are state exactly where the mole is located on the body (upper left arm).

using technology, an easier way to consolidate photographs to electronic charts so its insync and fluid. right now its a little clunky because the photographic system we have is on a different server and you have to flip flop between systems. if the system was more unified and fast it would make it easier to track these things.
ive heard it loosely thrown around. it applies to insurance providers that are outside of kaiser. kaiser is allcentered around valuebased care.
the way the physicians practice, and the model, is not exactly the same as other insurance providers.
How do patients currently keep track of: for patients that are atrisk, selfskin exam once a month when their fully undressed, say after the shower. becoming familiar with their skin, like learning the constellations in the sky. pay attention to see if over time, they notice new spots.
some who are more savvy take pictures of moles and put little stickers with dates on them. they then accumulate a photo gallery.
some take them with polaroids and bring in a box.
How do you acquire patients?: its a referral basis, either through primary care doctor or through another dermatologist
in my practice, about 2/3rds can identify risk factors
through a screening exam through their primary care doctor who discovers it via full body exam
What kinds of educational material do yo: if its a deeper melanoma, gets a lymph node sampling
if lymph node is positive, then further more larger treatments
when its localized, not much to track, generally patients feel their skin and lymph nodes, selfchecks
when metastatic, lesions are track via scans
name: Dr. Javier

Do you think an educational app would be: no not right now.
Do you think it would be beneficial for: yes because i feel like its a no brainer. its something you can take a picture of and then identify. it would be useful.
Have you ever known someone with, or hea: heard of melanoma but nobody i know.
How do you currently keep track of skin: when i notice something different, but nothing regular
How would you find this app?: through a skin care commercial on youtube
an ad on services that people need it the most use, like twitter because its made for reading. facebook. maybe instagram but those ads are easy to ignore.
audio ad on pandora, music streaming apps, some games
Is it okay to follow up with you?: yes, earlshine@gmail.com (email earl the full research paper).
What do you do if you have a skin issue?: depends on what it is. if its eczema i put on creme, if its different ill google it.
lastly i go to the doctor
Where would you go to learn about Melano: google it, then talk to a doctor, or someone i know
Would it be helpful to you to have an ap: yes because its like a greenback. people who would know your skin.
name: Earl

Do you think an educational app would be: yes
Do you think it would be beneficial for: no

Would it be helpful to you to have an ap: yes

What do you do if you have a skin issue?: google how to take care of it
Where would you go to learn about Melano: online, american cancer association or something like that

Do you have any moles or other skin cond: heard of it and have known some white people.
if something of immediate concern, a dermatologist
stuff ive seen on the news, ive heard the myth of black people cant get skin cancer and ive learn that that is not true
if my doctor told me a little more about it that would be beneficial.
never had a doctor broach the subject, had to learn it through the news media
something similar to whats been published to checking for lumps in the breast for breast cancer, to do it on a monthly basis.
google it or ask a friend for a referral because thats my practice when it comes to doctors.
id rather talk to a friend who is happy with their doctor because it gives me a reference and makes me comfortable and convinced that ill have a good experience.

Do you think an educational app would be: yes

name: Ife

Do you know about the risk factors of Me: yes, even uv lighting is an issue, which is why i use sunscreen (even sesame oil is a natural sunscreen)
Do you think an educational app would be: only if it included the ability to scan it and compare it to something, kids want an immediate fix, if you could scan your skin then ask the app should you go get this checked, then yes.
Do you think it would be beneficial for: yes, absolutely because were moving that way anyway. meaning, having an android assess you, triage you before actually see a physician.
Have you ever known someone with, or hea: yes, ive had several students who ive encouraged to go get checked and they did have it.
How do you currently keep track of skin: i do a lot of self skin care. i have a mole that i want taken off but my dermatologist said no. they said they didnt want to stimulate cancer cells.
How would you find this app?: probably from my medical provider, my medical insurance gives me $75 to keep up with my mammograms
What do you do if you have a skin issue?: i try to treat it naturally first, try not to put chemicals on my face. i live in sunscreen.
Where would you go to learn about Melano: today the internet but when i was teaching, peer reviews and anything that came from nih or mayo clinic
Would it be helpful to you to have an ap: yes, and convenient to where you are. and to connect you with your health plan to let you know if its in network or out of network.
name: Jacqueline

Do you have any moles or other skin cond: yes, i suffer from eczema and sever eczema before
Do you know about the risk factors of Me: not as much as i should but i know some
Do you think an educational app would be: yes, very much. i think its important for people to be able to learn about it as fast as possible and treat it very quickly to catch it at an early stage.s
Do you think it would be beneficial for: yes, it would make it more convenient and accessible
Have you ever known someone with, or hea: yes, it runs through my family. my great grandfather had it. and my grandfather has a less serious case of it. they are the white side of my family.
How do you currently find out about Mela: just through seeing other people go through it, experience
How do you currently keep track of skin: i keep documentation (write it down and make sure the doctor has it) take photos to have a record
How would you find this app?: apple store search
What do you do if you have a skin issue?: i contact my grandparents and go to the dermatologist
Where would you go to learn about Melano: to my grandfather who is currently diagnosed.
Would it be helpful to you to have an ap: yes, definitely
name: Jade

Do you think an educational app would be: no because id use the internet. before someone gets to an app theyd go to google or webmd. unless someone actually has the disease theyll never get to the app.
Do you think it would be beneficial for: no. because i wouldnt take time to put them in there.

Do you think it would be beneficial for: yes that would be helpful. there seems to be a lot of apps helpful for people who track things. like if you were on vacation you could take pictures throughout it to see if you notice any differences.
Have you ever known someone with, or hea: i am aware of it but dont know anyone.
How do you currently find out about Mela: google it, and make sure its a reputable source. id also ask my wife.
How do you currently keep track of skin: i dont. if something comes up ill notice it.
How would you find this app?: word of mouth, or through a targeted ad
What do you do if you have a skin issue?: ask my wife to look at it
google it to see what can be done about it
Where would you go to learn about Melano: id google it, then make sure that the source i find is reputable.
Would it be helpful to you to have an ap: yes, ive heard that melanin gives me more protection but ive also heard that that is wrong so it would be nice to have a dermatologist that focuses on black people.

name: Samia

Do you think an educational app would be: yes as long as it works in conjunction with some other kind of outreach. a lot of folks pick up the information via the community first, and then they may pick up the app.
Do you think it would be beneficial for: yes
Have you ever known someone with, or hea: yes, ive known a few white friends in lincoln ne who developed melanoma from sun bathing or suntanning booths, they believe.
How do you currently find out about Mela: an online search first, i usually go to google scholar, and then also my dermatologist (dr. donald frisbee)
How do you currently keep track of skin: with moles and skin tags, if i feel discomfort, or see noticeable changes in the growth or texture, or any other discoloration, i check it about once a month. i then call my dermatologist, and hell ask me to take a photo and then he directs me from there.
How would you find this app?: probably through a search engine, like google chrome.
Is it okay to follow up with you?: call dr. frisbee and mention lee ross (dr. shantella shermans mom)
What do you do if you have a skin issue?: i call my dermatologist immediately
Would it be helpful to you to have an ap: maybe, but i would go word of mouth before i trust an app. if its built from people who i would trust, my community, unlike, say yelp, which is people i dont know, i would be inclined to use it.
